title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) – In the annals of basketball, there are performances that defy description, nights where one man transcends the sport and carves his name into history. On this night in 1998, Hakeem Olajuwon authored one such masterpiece, single-handedly dismantling the San Antonio Spurs in a breathtaking 108-78 Rockets victory.

The final score tells a story of dominance, but the stat line tells a legend. Olajuwon was simply unstoppable, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 51 points. He was a whirlwind in the post, a force of nature the Spurs had no answer for, adding 14 rebounds and 3 blocks for good measure. Every possession was a clinic, a display of footwork, power, and precision that left the visitors bewildered.

While "The Dream" was conducting his symphony, his running mate Clyde Drexler provided the perfect harmony, dishing out 10 assists, many of which found Olajuwon for easy buckets. The Rockets' defense, anchored by their titan, smothered San Antonio into submission.

The Spurs, led by 16 points from Vinny Del Negro and 15 from Tim Duncan, were simply witnesses to greatness. They were not just beaten by a team; they were overwhelmed by an individual at the absolute peak of his powers.

In the end, this was more than a game; it was a coronation. On this night, Hakeem Olajuwon didn't just play basketball, he perfected it, delivering a 51-point opus that will forever echo throughout the halls of NBA lore.
